instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
not water damaged

customer says he replaced the battery and saw some sparking

it turns on on charger, there is green light, but very slow
-when battery connected wont change to orange light
-only on the battery wont power on
-when powered on with battery and charger, then i remove the charger it stays on, its just wont power on only on the battery

rarely wont even power on with charger, in this case the g3h is only 4.4V instead of 12V

i replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>, same 
reflowed smc , same 


the 10 ohm resistors are good, 20ohm measured on the cap, and the 2.2 and 0 ohm is good as well, 2.9ohm measured on the cap

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
Did you check resistance between pins 27/28, as 17/18 too?
The battery is recognized at least by macOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
i replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again, cause g3h was 4.4v, it died, so now it powers on again

resistance measured on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> legs 27/28  22ohm, 17/18 3.8ohm, so the tracks are good from the resistors


osx doesnt see the battery at all, and if i remove the charger the screen goes black and never comes back but it stats powered on, 

-fan is running high all the time, i guess it doesnt detect the battery temp?


on <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> 
without charger:
pin 5 : 11.5V
pin 4 : 4.4V

with charger:

pin 5 : 11.5V
pin 4 : 12V


r 7050: 12.24V both sides

it has i5 cpu, all 4 cores are going 100% in the  activity monitor

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
smc reset, and pram reset works

i had to reball the smc a few time on these <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook, could it be the smc, the customer mentioned saw spark when he replaced the battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message: i mean i did not reball smc on this specific macbook, just in general on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
SMC doesn't communicate with <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and battery; that's the reason of 12.24V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Valuable information, which you didn't post in the first post.

Check voltage and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
battery connector pin 6 is 0.14v in diode mode, black probe on gnd,    0.4V only

pin 4 is 1.14V, and that has 3.3v 

removed the protection diode <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>, same, something pulling down the line

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
Diode mode MUST ALWAYS be measured with red probe on ground...

Did you disconnect BIL?
Then only remain <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and SMC.
Also check <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>/81.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message:
so it turned out the new battery somehow killed the that part of the smc and the battery indicator light, and eventually the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

so i replaced the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> then the smc, and just not connect the BIL (who needs that), and it works fine now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on on battery
threads.message: i meant i just not connected the BIL
